CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: Because of the strong aggregation strength , PffBB-n equipped with long alkyl side chains shows enhanced ordered molecular packing and good crystallinity as revealed by X-ray diffraction studies.

Let's think step by step.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| PffBB-n |
| PffBB-n equipped with long alkyl side chains |

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material name" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Sure, here's the updated table with the valid entities:

| Material Name |
| --- |
| PffBB-n |

The entity "PffBB-n equipped with long alkyl side chains" is not a valid material name, as it describes a modified version of the material PffBB-n, rather than a distinct material. Therefore, it has been removed from the table.

PN.content:
Please identify the "Property Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: Because of the strong aggregation strength , PffBB-n equipped with long alkyl side chains shows enhanced ordered molecular packing and good crystallinity as revealed by X-ray diffraction studies.

Let's think step by step.

| Property Name |
| --- |
| aggregation strength |
| molecular packing |
| crystallinity |

The three property names mentioned in the paragraph are:

1. Aggregation strength
2. Molecular packing
3. Crystallinity

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material property" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Name |
| --- |
| crystallinity |

The only property name that clearly refers to a material property in the given paragraph is "crystallinity". The other two entities, "aggregation strength" and "molecular packing", could refer to properties of materials, but they are not as specific or unambiguous as "crystallinity". Therefore, the table above contains only "crystallinity" as a valid property name.
